reg_info.reg_name_text: TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT IN DEFINED INDUSTRIES — CITY OF TORONTO PUBLIC TRANSIT
reg_info.citation: O. Reg. 294/03: TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT IN DEFINED INDUSTRIES - CITY OF TORONTO PUBLIC TRANSIT
reg_info.act_under: Employment Standards Act, 2000   Loi de 2000 sur les normes d’emploi

content.content: 1. In this Regulation, “defined industry” means the industry of providing public transit services in the City of Toronto. O. Reg. 294/03, s. 1.
content.raw_html:
1. In this Regulation,

“defined industry” means the industry of providing public transit services in the City of Toronto. O. Reg. 294/03, s. 1.

content.content: 2. (1) This Regulation sets out terms and conditions of employment that apply to employees and employers in the defined industry. O. Reg. 294/03. s. 2 (1). (2) Except as modified by this Regulation, the Act applies to employers and employees in the defined industry. O. Reg. 294/03, s. 2 (2).
content.raw_html:
2. (1) This Regulation sets out terms and conditions of employment that apply to employees and employers in the defined industry. O. Reg. 294/03. s. 2 (1).

(2) Except as modified by this Regulation, the Act applies to employers and employees in the defined industry. O. Reg. 294/03, s. 2 (2).

content.content: 3. (1) An employer may permit an employee to work any number of hours in excess of an amount set out in subsection 17 (1) of the Act if, (a) the employee agrees to work those hours; and (b) the employee will not work more than 78 hours in a work week. O. Reg. 294/03, s. 3 (1). (2) Subsection (1) applies instead of subsection 17 (2) of the Act. O. Reg. 294/03, s. 3 (2).
content.raw_html:
3. (1) An employer may permit an employee to work any number of hours in excess of an amount set out in subsection 17 (1) of the Act if,

(a) the employee agrees to work those hours; and

(b) the employee will not work more than 78 hours in a work week. O. Reg. 294/03, s. 3 (1).

(2) Subsection (1) applies instead of subsection 17 (2) of the Act. O. Reg. 294/03, s. 3 (2).

content.content: 4. Subsection 18 (1) of the Act applies but shall be read as if the words “at least 11 consecutive hours” were struck out and “at least 8 consecutive hours” substituted. O. Reg. 294/03, s. 4.
content.raw_html: 4. Subsection 18 (1) of the Act applies but shall be read as if the words “at least 11 consecutive hours” were struck out and “at least 8 consecutive hours” substituted. O. Reg. 294/03, s. 4.

content.content: 5. Omitted (provides for the revocation of this Regulation). O. Reg. 294/03, s. 5.
